name: Financial Markets: Anomalies and Efficiencies

prereqs.text: (70-391 [] at least D) or (70-424 [] at least D) or (70-428 [] at least D)

long_desc: This course is offered only at Carnegie Mellons campus in Qatar.  TThis is a hands on course developed to provide students exposure to the companies listed on the Qatar Stock Exchange using a mix of financial and market based measures.  The course is structured in a business meeting format with each student being assigned the task of conducting analysis on a subset of firms to arrive with a final group selection of 1520 companies.  Selection filters will initially include financial and market based KPIs with focus shifting to financial models such as comparable metrics and the dividend discount model.

custom_fields.goals: 1.Understand how equity markets work in terms of microstructure,2.Carry out valuation of financial assets,3.Identify investment opportunities based on a mix of valuation and market timing,4.Evaluate performance of investment funds.
custom_fields.key_topics: This is a hands on course developed to provide students exposure to the companies listed on the Qatar Stock Exchange using a mix of financial and market based measures. The course is structured in a business meeting format with each student being assigned the task of conducting analysis on a subset of firms to arrive with a final group selection of 15-20 companies. Selection filters will initially include financial and market based KPIs with focus shifting to financial models such as comparable metrics and the dividend discount model.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Students should have taken at least one of the three pre-requisite courses; Finance, Financial Statement Analysis or Corporate Finance Financial Reporting.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: The grading for this course will be based on a mix of class engagement, 3 class submissions, a midterm with take home and in class components. The final deliverable for the course will be a valuation report and a final presentation made to an investment board.
custom_fields.relevance: While this course is part of the Accounting concentration, it is highly recommended to any student wishing to work in the financial sector or looking to develop a deeper understanding of the main industries in Qatar.
custom_fields.learning_resources: There will be a heavy usage of financial databases like Bloomberg or Eikon. Students will also be assigned articles from academic and practitioner journals.
